website_summaries.verdict: A functional and popular bike computer from a newer brand.
pros: Compatible with the most popular cycling apps and syncs live for real-time data
Easy to connect to any device wirelessly
Can show your smartphone notifications on screen when your phone is wirelessly connected
cons: Some users dislike the routing and navigation compared to Garmin

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the competition, worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bundle, it comes with a cadence sensor for your cranks, a speed sensor for your wheel hub, the head unit, and a chest heart rate sensor. They connect amazing, and the integration with Strava is amazing. They also work great with Zwift for you indoor cyclists, and don't require an ANT+ adapter as they are Bluetooth compatible. Amazing customizability, accurate. I would not recommend this for entry cyclists as it is a large investment, but if you are committed to cycling, totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: The screen did not works! No show anything...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this last week and it was OK for the first test riding for an hour. But the screen went off during second riding. And never get the screen back. I am a big fan of Wahoo ; I have many wahoo product including kickr, bike computer, tickr. But it makes me have a first and big bad impression on this. I submitted my situation to customer service of Wahoo and have been waiting for a few days so far but did not get any feedback yet. Hope to have feedback from them soon.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase but you will need special Tool
customer_reviews.text: I like the simple design and easy to use concept. Product is perfect but there’s a problem the company might consider minor which can make a big difference to consumers like myself. How do you market a product that requires special installation tool without including the tool in the box? I recommend you (the buyer) add 2.5mm Allen wrench to your shopping cart or go down to auto zone to get one (you are welcome for that Top Secret clearance). I thought I had it in my auto repair kit but was disappointed to find none of mine fits. I gave 4 star for the hardship.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-El

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cycling computers out there...period
customer_reviews.text: After using cycling computers since the 80s and, more recently, the lineup of Garmin products, the Wahoo Elemnt Bolt (and Elemnt which is on my MTB) are clearly the most accurate, advanced and problem-free. The set up is by far the easiest and the integrations are just about as easy as any other brand, especially for synching with Strava and other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Gary May

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why I didn't get one from the start...
customer_reviews.text: I got this after I crashed and my Garmin watch cracked after hitting the pavement on a crash. I know many people that owned one and knew the product was great before I got one myself. I have ridden with this on road, trail, and singletrack. It tracks better than any Garmin than I have ever used. I have three sensors synced up to it, and the battery life is still amazing despite hours of connection on rides.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: This Bike Computer Rocks
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this bike computer. I purchased this to replace and update my Garmin Edge 305 and what a difference this computer is. Love the phone crossover and easy setup. I use the full setup on my road bike and just the GPS on my mountain bike. Screen is easy to read and my ride automatically updates to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Little

customer_reviews.title: Defective display
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you unpack and install this item right away. I ordered it at the end of cycling season (October), intending to use it the next year. When I unpacked it the next spring, the display had a huge "pool" of black that obscured 80% of the display. Unfortunately, the return window is only 30 days. I discovered the defect months too late.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Berg III MD

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo bolt
customer_reviews.text: My first bike computer. I was planning to buy a garmin edge 530. But ended up with wahoo bolt It’s a tiny little computer but efficient , I used it 3-4 times till now. While it connects easily to speed sensors and cadence as well as heart rate. But when comparing it to garmin fenix 3 , cadence numbers are always off. The average is less. But the maximum is the same. Also the calories burnt are different. It’s more on the wahoo than garmin Other than that. Both identical in speed and time travelled as well as distance
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed  El Morr

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Garmin 510 and Wahoo synchs with Garmin cadence and heart rate sensors perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my Garmin 510 and decided to try Wahoo ELEMNT Bolt. I was able to buy just the computer and use my Garmin cadence and heart rate sensors without any trouble. The Wahoo uses an app on my smart phone to change the settings on my device but the process is fairly simple (lots of videos on YouTube if you can't follow the instructions). The Wahoo was easy to set up and link to my Strava account. The Bolt is slightly smaller than the Garmin 510 but has more features (which I will have to learn to set up). I like it as much or more as my Garmin 510 which currently isn't working.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lau

customer_reviews.title: It works great until it doesnt.
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Elemnt Bolt for 3 weeks now. At first it was fun to use while I was biking around the city. It pairs easily with my speed and cadence sensor and does a good job of giving me directions. If you take a wrong turn while on a preset route it doesnt have the ability to update the directions. Its like printing out mapquest which is very unfortunate. Yesterday my battery died in the middle of the ride and now after charging it the screen wont turn on. I've tried everything to reset it and I've contacted wahoo support but no luck..
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Hidden Costs to use Workouts is a Deal Breaker
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about the Wahoo bolt except the hidden costs. As a serious athlete, the ability to build structured workouts is a critical feature for a cycling computer. To build your own workouts after 30 days, one must purchase a premium subscription to a 3rd party app. The cost for a yearly subscription to training peaks is $120.00. You can build your own workouts for free on the Garmin Connect app. So it's back to Garmin for me.
customer_reviews.author: michael toth

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT UPLOAD RIDES TO ELEMNT BOLT COMPANION!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cycling computer solely to upload my stats onto Strava. However, despite going through numerous setups. I can't even get the darn thing to upload my workouts onto the "History" section of the Elemnt companion app. I've updated the firmware. I even tried a factory reset and updating the firmware again. I tried switching between different house wifi and work wifi. Nothing gets the workouts from the cycling computer to the companion app which is the gateway to Strava and other third party apps for biking. I'm very disappointed and will be returning the units soon. Yes, I bought two for me and my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and fool-proof
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews on this computer with many commenting on the ease of set up. They did not lie. Blu-tooth connections can be quite fiddly on many devices. Wiith the Element Bolt you scan a QR code and you are essentially done. The application walks you through the apps that you want to sync with, Strava for instance, and everything is auto-pilot from then on. No need to carry the phone with you. Once your ride is complete the computer will sync with Strava and upload your ride. Simplicity at its finest. This is a great investment for the price and I highly recommend it to any biker.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike computer. I was apprehensive and skeptical of the price when purchasing; however, I couldn’t be any happier with the purchase and will buy one again on my next bike. It communicates with my cell phone, helmet, and other ride apps. The speed sensor was a bit tricky to install and I actually ripped a piece of the rubber but it’s fastened fairly well even still. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very much like my Wahoo Bolt! Very easy to use. The app is great for setting it up and doing what you need with it. Has all the vital and popular displays, including dual power meter readings. I was debating between Wahoo and Garmin and glad I decided on this Wahoo. I know heard Garmin is superior with maps and routing, but I don’t need or use that often. I like the user friendly interface with the Wahoo. Also, Garmin has recently expired issues with being offline due to server being hacked, as I was told. No issue with Wahoo 😃
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Little GPS Computer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little GPS, though it does have a few issues. Without fail, I must start my ride, move forward, come to a stop, and wait for auto-pause, otherwise my speed lags upwards of 30 seconds from reality. It’s almost as if it must be reset each ride. Otherwise, I love it. Doesn’t crash, so I haven’t lost a single ride in a long time. Overall, it’s more accurate than a phone GPS. Connects to a variety of devices including HRM and sensors from other vendors. Integration with Strava is top-notch. Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Warren Ayen

customer_reviews.title: Retuned
customer_reviews.text: My original Elemnt failed after 13 months. Just out of warranty. Wahoo told me to pound sand. I reluctantly bought this one. After 6 rides I saw the rubber door would not stay shut allowing sweat and water in. Not only is this door in bad placement but it also started acting up because of the water issue. I decided to return so I dont get stuck with another bad unit. The elevation was always way off. The mileage was fair. HR seemed right. Return was simple. I would not recommend this unit
customer_reviews.author: Harris Family

customer_reviews.title: great computer
customer_reviews.text: my opinion is way better than garman ! i i had 3 gar mans and had nothing but problems !
customer_reviews.author: steve johnson

customer_reviews.title: 50 percent of the time, it works every time.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good on the road bike. But it’s driving me insane on the trails. It’s wildly inconsistent when working with Strava. It’ completely in accurate on segment times. So I had to revert to using my phone to record rides but at the same time recording with the wahoo for heart rate functions. It usually will sync to strava after. But now all of a sudden it won’t. It’s awesome when it works. But it’s just so inconsistent. I feel like every time I use it something different doesn’t work properly. 50 percent of the time, it works great. Not good enough for this kinda money.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T.

customer_reviews.title: Useless without Obamaphone
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to upgrade from my Bolt Mini. Which I removed and repaired perfectly in the process of trying to get this to pair. The QR code from this did not read. I guess I am going to have to "neg" this on "tiktok" with my Obamaphone will puffing "dope af" clouds with my "zuul pod." I'm joking but like also not.
customer_reviews.author: Night Crawler

customer_reviews.title: Better than Garmin
customer_reviews.text: The Bolt is easy to set up using the phone app. Pairs so easily. Simple to use and has so many features for a great price. Prior to the bolt I was using a Garmin 1000. The Garmin has too many bugs, pairing issues, and struggles to find satellites. The Bolt so much better to set up. Pairs with iPhone so easily and works exactly like it should. The phone app is great for wahoo!
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need!
customer_reviews.text: After my old Garman died after 15 years, I tried a less expensive alternative thinking that I a non GPS tracker would be OK but I was wrong - it never worked correctly so I did my research and settled on the Wahoo Bolt - after using it several times, I still have 25% battery life remaining and it works perfectly. Large, easy to read display, syncs with Strava. It is everything that I need or want.
customer_reviews.author: Kent T.

customer_reviews.title: Near Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Everything works amazingly and it is the perfect size for what I wanted, BUT it doesn't sync with my phone and display messages or anything else, which was the whole reason I bought it. Still trying to see if I can get a fix on the message boards or from Wahoo, but after 3 different fix attempts it still doesn't work like it should. It is the ONLY reason I have given it a 3 instead of a 5. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Maio

customer_reviews.title: Great computer, app seems to have some hitches.
customer_reviews.text: My last computer was a Garmin from about 10 years ago. So this is a big upgrade. I am very happy with the features and operation of the unit itself. Seems to have very good accuracy when compared to routes created in Ride with GPS. I love that it's linked with Strava and I don't have to do anything to get my rides onto Strava. My only issue is that the app shows there is a firmware update and it doesn't seem to install. So it keeps telling me there's an update each time I fire up the app. Hopefully this will eventually clear up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Easy Bluetooth connectivity and integration with Di2
customer_reviews.text: Seamless synch with my Shimano Di2 Bluetooth on my Focus Paralane2 bike. Easy connectivity with the Bluetooth controller buttons on the shifter heads allowing scrolling through screens while riding. GPS works really well in the mountains with good resolution showing gravel roads. Love the altitude stats after a 1700 ft climb yesterday up 4 miles of gravel road in Twisp
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo is the best bike computer
customer_reviews.text: I took my first long bike ride 8+hours in the August summer heat and a little rain. I was depending on wahoo bike Computer to keep me on the right path. It was accurate, easy to read. Automatically adjusted the lighting to see even when riding through a dark tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Garmin, Hello Wahoo
customer_reviews.text: Best cycling computer I've ever owned. So many features, so easy to install and setup. Get the bundle, save yourself the money and get everything you need at once. No issues pairing the HR monitor, speed and cadence sensors. Stop searching, start buying.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Moline

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I particularly like the fact that I can switch it from my "outdoor" to my "indoor" bike. It comes with a great app that allows you to customize certain aspects of the interface, such as reorienting maps as you turn, so that they are always aligned with the direction you are traveling. When synced with Strava, there are slight differences in the mileage and climbing totals for each ride, between the two, but otherwise it is a great device, and much more reliable than the bike computer it replaces.
customer_reviews.author: EWG

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hardware but good software.
customer_reviews.text: The screen went blank during my third ride. Had the unit less than a week. When I hit one of the bottom buttons during my ride, I noticed a black ink like stain on the screen and then the screen went blank. I have returned the unit and waiting for replacement. Let’s hope I get more than 3 rides out of the next unit. I will downgrade or upgrade my score further as I use the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Sfeir

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike computer for road and mountain biking
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical that I even needed a fancy bike computer, but trying this device sold me. Full integration of my power meter, speed/cadence sensor and heart rate monitor, not to mention a great app that ties it all together. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: TEK

customer_reviews.title: A lot of money for nothing
customer_reviews.text: Don’t spend your money on this computer. It won’t calculate calories you need to spend more money to buy the heart rate sensor that is ridiculous. All other computers in the market calculate calories just with the algorithms. Very disappointed for the money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Perez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Computer
customer_reviews.text: Tested both the Elemnt & a Garmin 520 at the same time - while both perform well I ended up keeping the Elemnt - slightly brighter & easier to read fonts. Both units are quite capable and you can't really go wrong with either one.
customer_reviews.author: George Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: Best Cycling Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm a college triathlete biking around 10 hours a week. I wasn't too sure about the Element Bolt until I got my hands on it. The simplicity and quality is great! With the Wahoo Element smartphone app, It's easy to arrange / customize data screens on the computer for several different occasions ( Training, Racing, Etc.). I've used it in sync with my Wahoo KICKR for workouts and taken it on several rides and have not been disappointed yet! Overall great product and probably the best all around bike computer on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Super easy.
customer_reviews.text: This wahoo just works. It’s easy to set up and pair with the phone app. Downloading routes from Strava is a breeze. Overall, it’s reliable and easy to read. Most of all it’s just easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: A Excellent Companion for a Bike Ride!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the GPS feature yet, but this monitors my HR wonderfully and accurately, as well as time and speed numbers. If the GPS works as expected, I will add a star.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Cash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up and calibrate! I used the next day and have been happy ever since. The battery life seems to be excellent so far after two months of use.
customer_reviews.author: andrew Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Unit kept Overheating and shutting down!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay this product is good, but it has it downsides. 1. Does not have turn by turn direction (only with paid subscription to RideWithGPS...) 3. DOES NOT SHOW ACCURATE GRADIENT ( grade %) AT ALL!!!! 2. Started to overheat out of the blue!!! and my workouts got lost!!!
customer_reviews.author: ralph

customer_reviews.title: screen dead in 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This was great while working, but today, in the middle of a smooth ride the screen stopped working. It's a simple no color LCD so really surprised. Will contact their support but really upsetting. In the middle of a difficult route to navigate, lost our tool navigation tool for the group.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve put about 800 miles on it. At first had some trouble with an update coming through but after it finally updated it works great! Love the auto pause feature when stopping at a traffic light.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Beats Garmin in every way
customer_reviews.text: Used to ride with different Garmin devices and their usability and design are absolutely awful and stuck in 1995. Finally a device that shows relevant information, connects flawlessly, is easy to navigate through the screens, and has a decent companion app.
customer_reviews.author: Petrovich

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: It takes a minute for old guys like me to set it up, but it’s very intuitive to work and provides great data to help me work out smarter
customer_reviews.author: AmySR

customer_reviews.title: Really like my Wahoo ELEMNT Bolt
customer_reviews.text: This Bolt does everything I need it to. Like the way it auto updates my Strava and RideWithGPS automatically. I do recommend the cadence sensor for RPM. Really pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best bike computer on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Liked this bike computer so much, I purchased a second one as a gift for my son. Use on both my mountain and road bikes. Love the GPS function, calculates to a foot position and altitude... Just spend an hour watching the YouTube videos on the Wahoo Bolt and you'll be sold. It lives up to i's reputation. Best addition I've made to my bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my garmin edge 500...love it!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding computer. Synced effortlessly with my built in electronics on my giant defy advanced pro 0
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Great but handlebar Mount not universal
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars. They include a handle bar mount for thick bars. Mine in narrower they have no exchange program per their support. They should. Another 40+ Dollars to buy from 3rd party.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Owsinski

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor very unstable and can't update software!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this purchase. The heart rate monitor is VERY unstable in connecting with the bike computer. Most of the time it does not connect! Also, the Bike Computer indicates there is an update available; however, the unit is STUCK is "Checking for Update". I left the unit on for the entire evening and it does not work!
customer_reviews.author: David Young

customer_reviews.title: Does not require Wahoo sensors.
customer_reviews.text: Just received. E-Z setup. Comes with mounting bracket (I was unsure if it did!). Does not require Wahoo brand sensors. Will update after first use.
customer_reviews.author: William Hunnell

customer_reviews.title: Good value, does the job, easy display
customer_reviews.text: I generally like it. I went from garmin 500 to wahoo bolt. 6 years newer tech. I like the display read out. Have gotten used to the “chirping” it makes stopping/going. Oddly, it’s not as precise as older Garmin. But, close enough for my needs. I would def recommend at this price point
customer_reviews.author: david schuh

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy to set up and use. Great alternative to a Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life and function. Good value for the money. Great alternative to Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sova

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just got my bolt bundle today, very nice looking unit. I really like how simple it was to set up with my phone. The only issue I had was with the speed sensor. While trying to attach it to the rear hub, one of the 3 rubber straps broke. Not a huge deal, I'm using a zip tie for now but its brand new. I think the rubber straps could be stronger. Otherwise, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Trek

customer_reviews.title: There is no battery life!
customer_reviews.text: It has to be plugged in after every ride and should come with a battery that lasts 1 yr if not 5 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: jon wayne faust

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the Best Cycle Computer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device. Friends recommended it and I have done the same. I know if not one person who has regretted this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have had this GPS for a month or so and used it for about 15 rides. Overall it is everything I hoped for. It is small, light, easy to use and easy to read. It comes with 2 attachments for your bike and both work well. It is accurate and the battery lasts forever. One of the things I really like is, if you open the app on your phone, texts and calls come to the GPS unit
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Easy to Use, Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Exactly how advertised.... spot on accuracy, ease of use and battery life is amazing. Connects to satellite for GPS immediately after pressing a single button. I especially love the auto-pause at every traffic light to keep actual riding time accurate for training purposes. I have already recommended to a couple of friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O

customer_reviews.title: Logical, simple and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from. Garmin 130. Other than battery life I’m glad I made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Cincinnati

customer_reviews.title: Great overall cycling computer.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific cycling computer. Well worth the cost. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Dislike I'm unable to connect my Samsung watch to device
customer_reviews.author: TIM J. SINGLETON

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast setup
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, very accurate and extremely easy to setup. I use it mostly for Heartrate monitoring and Stava segments. It works flawlessly, I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Alodesign

customer_reviews.title: Not fully functional without adding sensors
customer_reviews.text: For $230 I would expect the mileage to be more than 80% accurate, which depending on where you ride is about what you get from this device. Yes I know all about speed sensors, but one should not have to spend an additional $40 just to get accurate mileage. Also the screen is too small to make the Maps useful.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love it, super easy to use, definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Jacob M

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy setup and very accurate. I love every feature of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Is this refurbished?
customer_reviews.text: This product was scratched in the back on what might be a serial number. I was under the impression that this was a new product. There is also a slight gouge in the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works, for the most part. Waiting for a wahoo fix to come out so it works perfectly. Wahoo says the update is a high priority! It best be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great navigation and integration
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple, inexpensive bike computer to work with my Strava and RideWithGPS accounts and provide simple, reliable navigation. Well, this guy does exactly that! Syncing is automatic and painfree. Navigation is simple and easy to follow. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Battery life was shorter than I expected and connectivity to my phone sometimes spotty. I wish there weren't so many software updates. At the end of the day, it works pretty well as a tracker/logger for rides at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It is very easy and it self sync with strava and Apple health. Very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Luca

customer_reviews.title: Flawed. No manual upload ability.
customer_reviews.text: This device simply does not sync with the latest version of iPhone software, even with very specific instructions from tech support and acknowledgment that they’re having issues. Unlike Garmin, THERE IS NO WAY TO MANUALLY UPLOAD RIDES IF THE APP DOESN’T sync. So it is essentially a brick.
customer_reviews.author: C Canonica

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo, the new animal of data collection
customer_reviews.text: Wahoo has not failed me yet. I have used G***** for years and years. This unit has some limiting factors compared to the larger unit. But the bundle is an excellent choice for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed King

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo bolt
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sweet computer. If your a data nerd like me you’ll love it. Pair it with the Wahoo Speed sensor and seems to be spot on. Works great on my MTB.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Collins

customer_reviews.title: All you need
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device... Very easy to set up and use. Extremely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: rd3inc

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: My wife already had one so I knew what I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: Farmkid

customer_reviews.title: Biking designed products amazing
customer_reviews.text: By far wahoo products are amazing and technically design for biking . Awesome 👏 products great Job guys
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing GPS computer
customer_reviews.text: Finally caved in and bought one, worth every penny. You don't need any of the sensors, it's great right out of the box. Love this thing
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: Great Cycling Computer!
customer_reviews.text: The Bolt replaced my old Garmin 500. This computer offers everything a cyclist could need. Very easy to use, set up, and easily connects with other apps. Great buy for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very hot
customer_reviews.text: this is a horrible product, got it less than a month and it just got extremely hot and wouldn't come on.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to add gpx routes and use with MapMyRide. Good battery life. Intuitive user interface and menus.
customer_reviews.author: ivan holmes

customer_reviews.title: solid cycling computer
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice little unit. Pairs well with my phone, Tickr fit and Blue SC. Best benefit is it gives a live track of my ride to anyone I share it with which my wife likes
customer_reviews.author: bill r.

customer_reviews.title: Great computer
customer_reviews.text: Love the bolt. The heart rate sensor takes a little while to register on a ride. Everything else works well.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple to Use
customer_reviews.text: The hype of simplicity is real. Get's the job done, collaborates with all my apps (Strava, Apple Health Kit, etc.) as advertised, and pairing the sensors easily makes this everything it's advertised to be.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bragg

customer_reviews.title: All that you’ll need
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bang for buck... great cycling computer for more advanced enthusiasts. Connect with power meter, do live strava segments, upload custom routes... this can do it all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for me
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Easy to sync with apps. It makes routing and tracking rides simple and automatic.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hascher

customer_reviews.title: great little computer
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an upgrade to my element mini, such a great upgrade. very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ride Giant!
customer_reviews.text: Great computer so far. I've only used it for two rides and so far I'm impressed. Easy to set up and navigate through menus.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Died after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Fine product, but died after a few weeks. Followed all of the recommended hacks to discharge-recharge-reboot to no avail. Hoping to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Hiten Madhani

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer but...
customer_reviews.text: Great computer, except the ambient temperature is off by 5 degrees. It’s to high. Other than that, nice computer. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Harris Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great computer, easy to set up and easy to customize.
customer_reviews.author: gregory s metz

product_meta.title: Wahoo ELEMNT Bolt GPS Bike Computer
feature_bullets: Download, pair, configure and ride! Wahoo's free ELEMNT Companion App automates pairing and manages the configuration process for fast, frustration free setup.
Automatic route downloads and uploads with compatible third party apps: Strava, Ride With GPS, Best Bike Split, Komoot, Singletracks, MTB Project
Package includes: Wahoo ELEMNT BOLT, Integrated Aero Out-Front mount, stem mount, and charging cable.

Build a route and get pop-up and LED turn-by-turn notifications on screen so you never miss a turn. Battery Life - 15 hours. Waterproof Rating - IPX7 (waterproof up to 5 ft). Supported Satellites - GPS, GLONASS, BEIDOU Galileo, and QZSS
Fully integrates with Strava Live Segments to give you accurate progress status and the Final Push to beat your goals.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
